intro: Corrigiola squamosa var. latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Europe and Asia. The plant features small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in early summer, and its leaves are typically broad and fleshy, adapted to conserve water. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous areas. Due to its drought tolerance, it is considered a hardy species suitable for xeriscaping and rock gardens.
